result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell A Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to probation within 72 hours of his release from confinement.

miscConds.notes: Cash bond applied. If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  Must not possess or consume controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed health care provider and only taken in the amounts prescribed. Must maintain absolute sobriety.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

Defendant Mitchell A Krueger in court with attorney Joseph H. Loso.  Defendant Mitchell A Krueger in custody.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 15CF420 AND 16CF129. Discussion regarding restitution amount. 

15CF420:
Court relates and orders:
SW
1 Yr Probation - must report within 72 hours of his release from confinement
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Must maintain absolute sobriety.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed healthcare provider.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Restitution in the amount of $725.00. C-31 filed.
Court costs + DNA surcharge
89 days jail with credit for 89 days

16CF129: Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed. Defendant pleads guilty to Count 5. Count 4 - DRI.
Court relates and orders: 
SW
1 Yr Probation - concurrent with 15CF420
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Must maintain absolute sobriety.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia unless prescribed by a licensed healthcare provider.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Court costs + DNA surcharge
23 days jail with credit for 23 days  

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Report to Barron County Jail immediately.

Clerked by DN.

State requests court take judicial notice of bond attached to complaint.
Argument by Attorney Loso regarding underlying felony case which had been amended to misdemeanor. 
Attorney O'Boyle requests time to research bond issue prior to court making a finding in a bind over for Defendant Krueger.  

16CF129 - Court adjourns Mr. Kruegers proceding. Court reserves ruling on whether this is a felony bail jumping due to misdemeanor conviction on earlier case. 

Bond revoked in 15CF420. Defendant returns to jail.
